Two things are to be noted here:

l. That salvation and grace are not to be sought in any other than in Him in whom it hath pleased God they should be sought. But concerning his will respecting it, we are tojudge from the word of revelation. In the whole busi- ness, therefore, of our salvation, this thought ought al- ways to be present to Christian minds, What is the good pleasure of God? For if we turn aside from his will, in. vain do we expect any good.
